name: Avoid using inline PERFORM with too many lines of code
description: This rules searches for Cobol programs containing PERFORM - END-PERFORM loops with more than 80 lines.
output:
Associated to each COBOL Program with violations, the Quality Rule provides:
- The number of violation occurrences
- Bookmarks for violation occurrences found in source code:
  - PERFORM - END-PERFORM block with more than 80 lines
rationale: If the code to be performed is short, an inline PERFORM can be easier to read. But if the code extends over several screens, the logical flow of the program might be clearer if you use an out-of-line PERFORM. (Each paragraph in structured programming should perform one logical function, however.)
reference: IBM Enterprise Cobol for z/OS - Programming Guide
remediation: Create a dedicated paragraph and put the lines of code in it. Then change the inline PERFORM to an out-of-line PERFORM.
remediationSample:
PAR-01.
     ...
     MOVE 0 TO CPT.
     PERFORM PAR-2 UNTIL CPT = 10.
     ...

 PAR-2.
* Lines of code on several screens
     ADD 1 TO CPT.
sample:
PAR-01.
     ...
     MOVE 0 TO CPT.
     PERFORM UNTIL CPT = 10
* Lines of code on several screens
         ADD 1 TO CPT
     END-PERFORM
     ...

qualityStandards.name: Source Element Excessive Size
qualityStandards.description:
Objective
Avoid over-sizing of software elements

Consequence
Software that does not follow the principles of modularity causes excessive propagation of modification impacts

Measure Element
Number of instances where a file has too many lines of code based on a threshold value. The default threshold value for number of lines of code is 1000
